title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night when the Chicago Bulls honored their dynasty with a ring ceremony, Michael Jordan reminded everyone why he was its undisputed king. In a breathtaking, historic performance, Jordan erupted for a game-high 47 points, single-handedly wrestling control of the game from the rival New York Knicks in a nail-biting 103-101 Bulls victory.

From the opening tip, Jordan was on a mission, attacking the rim with a ferocity that defied the celebratory atmosphere. While the Knicks, led by Allan Houston’s 22 points, tried to counter with physical defense, Jordan was simply unstoppable. He sliced through double-teams, hit contested fadeaways, and fueled a raucous United Center crowd with every basket.

The game hung in the balance until the final possession. With seconds remaining and the Bulls clinging to a two-point lead, Patrick Ewing’s potential game-tying shot rattled out, sealing the win. But the story was already written. Jordan’s 47-point masterpiece, a stunning display of individual brilliance, had overshadowed a ring ceremony and stolen the show on opening night. It was a signature performance from the game’s greatest player, a powerful statement that the throne was still very much occupied.
